intro: Haplopappus tehuelches, commonly known as the Tehuelche fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its yellowish flowers bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Haplopappus tehuelches plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest to botanists studying desert flora.
